title: Shelling heard around Syrian town after Turkish-U.S. ceasefire deal
text:
FILE PHOTO: Smoke rises over the Syrian town of Ras al-Ain as seen from the Turkish border town of Ceylanpinar, Sanliurfa province, Turkey, October 17, 2019. REUTERS/Stoyan Nenov

CEYLANPINAR, Turkey (Reuters) - Shelling and gunfire resonated in the area of northeast Syria’s Ras al Ain town on Friday, a Reuters reporter said, a day after Turkey agreed with the United States to pause its offensive in Syria for five days to let Kurdish-led forces withdraw.

The reporter, in the Turkish town of Ceylanpinar across the border from Ras al Ain, heard the sound of machine-gun fire and shelling in the area of the Syrian town.
description: Shelling and gunfire resonated in the area of northeast Syria's Ras al Ain town on Friday, a Reuters reporter said, a day after Turkey agreed with the United States to pause its offensive in Syria for five days to let Kurdish-led forces withdraw.
